description.narrative: EPI: Quality expanded programme of immunization (EPI) services are available and demanded by families, to protect women and girls and boys from vaccine-preventable diseases, especially in most deprived areas,which contributes to Child Health, Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access and increased utilization of quality and equity focused MNCH and immunization services for mothers, new born, U5 children and adolescent girls in most deprived provinces and areas

sector.narrative: Immunization supply chain, including cold chain

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: EPI: Quality expanded programme of immunization (EPI) services are available and demanded by families, to protect women and girls and boys from vaccine-preventable diseases, especially in most deprived areas

description.narrative: Around 1.4 million children and 6 million women of child-bearing age are now accessing improved vaccination services as a result of UNICEF's support to national and subnational EPI service delivery and cold and supply chain management, appropriate skills building for better accountability, and provision of vaccines and dry supplies. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:20/07/2020
